verses.devanagari:
केनेषितं पतति प्रेषितं मनः ।
केन प्राणः प्रथमः प्रैति युक्तः ।
केनेषिता वाचमिमां वदन्ति ।
चक्षुः श्रोत्रं क उ देवो युनक्ति ॥
verses.iast:
keneṣitaṁ patati preṣitaṁ manaḥ |
kena prāṇaḥ prathamaḥ praiti yuktaḥ |
keneṣitā vācam imāṁ vadanti |
cakṣuḥ śrotraṁ ka u devo yunakti ||
verses.translation: By whose direction does the mind, being driven, race forth? By whose order does the chief prāṇa move, being yoked? By whose will do speakers utter this speech? Who, indeed, is that deva who empowers the eye and the ear?

verses.devanagari:
श्रोत्रस्य श्रोत्रं मनसो मनो यद् ।
वाचो ह वाचं स उ प्राणस्य प्राणः ।
चक्षुषश्चक्षुरतिमुच्य धीराः ।
प्रेत्यास्माल्लोकादमृता भवन्ति ॥
verses.iast:
śrotrasya śrotraṁ manaso mano yad |
vāco ha vācaṁ sa u prāṇasya prāṇaḥ |
cakṣuṣaś cakṣur atimucya dhīrāḥ |
pretyāsmāl lokād amṛtā bhavanti ||
verses.translation: He is the hearing of the ear, the mind’s mind, the speech of speech; He indeed is the life of life-breath and the eye’s sight. The sober, loosening themselves from sense-clinging, depart this world and attain immortality.

verses.devanagari:
यद्वाचा नाभ्युदितं येन वागभ्युद्यते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yadvācā nābhyuditaṁ yena vāg abhyudyate |
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate ||
verses.translation: That which speech cannot announce, yet by which speech is impelled—know that alone to be Brahman, not this that people adore as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यन्मनसा न मनुते येनाहुर्मनो मतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yan manasā na manute yenāhur mano matam |
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate ||

word_by_word.english: not this that is worshiped as such

verses.translation: What the mind cannot grasp, yet by which the mind is said to think—know that alone to be Brahman, not this that people put before themselves for worship.

verses.devanagari:
यच्चक्षुषा न पश्यति येन चक्षूंषि पश्यति ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yac cakṣuṣā na paśyati yena cakṣūṁṣi paśyati |
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate ||

word_by_word.english: which is worshiped as an object

verses.translation: That which the eye does not see, yet by which the eyes see—know that alone to be Brahman, not this that people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यच्छ्रोत्रेण न शृणोति येन श्रोत्रमिदं श्रुतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yac chrotreṇa na śṛṇoti yena śrotram idaṁ śrutam |
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate ||

word_by_word.english: not this that is worshiped here

verses.translation: That which one does not hear with the ear, yet by which the ear hears—know that alone to be Brahman, not this that people honor as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यत्प्राणेन न प्रणिति येन प्राणः प्रणीयते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yat prāṇena na praṇiti yena prāṇaḥ praṇīyate |
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate ||

word_by_word.english: which is worshiped as an object

verses.translation: That by which prāṇa is moved, while prāṇa cannot move It—know that alone to be Brahman, not this that men worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यद् श्रोत्रेण न शृणोति येन श्रोत्रमिदं श्रुतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yad śrotreṇa na śṛṇoti yena śrotram idaṃ śrutam |
tadeva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate ||
verses.translation: That which the ear cannot hear, yet by which the ear hears—know that alone to be Brahman; not this thing that men worship.
verses.padaccheda: yad śrotreṇa na śṛṇoti | yena śrotram idaṃ śrutam | tat eva brahma tvam viddhi | na idaṃ yat idam upāsate
verses.context: Part of the series declaring Brahman as the inner power of the senses, yet beyond them.

verses.devanagari:
यत् प्राणेन न प्राणिति येन प्राणः प्राणीयते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yat prāṇena na prāṇiti yena prāṇaḥ prāṇīyate |
tadeva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate ||
verses.translation: That which does not live by the prāṇa, yet by which prāṇa is moved—know that alone to be Brahman; not this object that people revere.
verses.padaccheda: yat prāṇena na prāṇiti | yena prāṇaḥ prāṇīyate | tat eva brahma tvam viddhi | na idaṃ yat idam upāsate
verses.context: Concludes the sense-series, pointing beyond vital breath to the sustaining Brahman.

verses.devanagari: यदि मन्यसे सुवेदेति दहरमेवापि नूनं त्वं वेत्थ ब्रह्मणो रूपम् । यदस्य त्वं यदस्मिन् देवा इति ॥
verses.iast: yadi manyase suvedeti daharamevāpi nūnaṁ tvaṁ vettha brahmaṇo rūpam | yadasya tvaṁ yadasmin devā iti ||
verses.translation: If you are thinking, ‘I know Brahman well,’ then surely you have only touched a tiny portion of His feature—what it is for you, or even among the gods. Therefore seek again, more deeply.
variants: dharamevāpi for daharamevāpi in some recensions
devā iti sometimes read as devāḥ iti
verses.speaker: Ācārya

verses.devanagari: नाहं मन्ये सुवेदेति नो न वेदेति वेद च । यो नस्तद्वेद तद्वेद नो न वेदेति वेद च ॥
verses.iast: nāhaṁ manye suvedeti no na vedeti veda ca | yo nas tad veda tad veda no na vedeti veda ca ||
verses.translation: I do not maintain, ‘I know it well,’ nor do I say, ‘I know it not.’ He among us who grasps this paradox—he knows; not as ignorance, and yet knowing indeed.
variants: yo naḥ tad veda sometimes written as yo nastad veda
verses.speaker: Śiṣya

verses.devanagari: यस्यामतं तस्य मतं मतं यस्य न वेद सः । अविज्ञातं विजानतां विज्ञातमविजानताम् ॥
verses.iast: yasyāmataṁ tasya mataṁ mataṁ yasya na veda saḥ | avijñātaṁ vijānātāṁ vijñātam avijānātām ||

word_by_word.english: it is not an object of conception
he knows it (as merely known) not
to those who think they know
to those who know they do not objectify

verses.translation: To the one who refuses to objectify it, it is realized; but he who claims a mere conceptual grasp—he knows it not. Unknown to the conceit of knowers; known to those who admit their not-knowing.
variants: amatam sometimes glossed as ‘not thought of as an object’

verses.devanagari: प्रतिबोधविदितं मतममृतत्वं हि विन्दते । आत्मना विन्दते वीर्यं विद्यया विन्दतेऽमृतम् ॥
verses.iast: pratibodhaviditaṁ matam amṛtatvaṁ hi vindate | ātmanā vindate vīryaṁ vidyayā vindate 'mṛtam ||

word_by_word.english: known in and through each state of awareness

verses.translation: When realized through every stir of consciousness—that is true knowing. By the Self one gains strength; by wisdom one attains the deathless goal.
verses.notes: pratibodha-viditam indicates recognition of Brahman as the ground in every cognition.

verses.devanagari: इह चेदवेदित् अथ सत्यं अस्ति । न चेदिहावेदित् महती विनष्टिः ॥
verses.iast: iha ced avedit atha satyaṁ asti | na ced ihāvedit mahatī vinaṣṭiḥ ||
verses.translation: If one realizes here, then the Truth is secured; if one fails to know it here, great is the loss indeed.
variants: avedit sometimes read as avedīt (aorist form)

verses.devanagari: तद् ह देवानां विजयोऽभूत्। ते ह्यभिमाना बभूवुः— ‘अस्माकमेवायं विजयः, अस्माकमेवायं महिमा’ इति।
verses.iast: tad ha devānāṁ vijayo ’bhūt. te hy abhimānā babhūvuḥ— ‘asmākam evāyaṁ vijayaḥ, asmākam evāyaṁ mahimā’ iti.
verses.translation: There was a victory for the gods, and they swelled with pride, saying, ‘This victory is ours, this glory is ours.’
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: The devas become conceited after triumph.

verses.devanagari: तद् ब्रह्म विजज्ञौ— ‘तेषामेवायं विजयः, तेषामेवायं महिमा’ इति। तेभ्यः प्रादुर्बभूव ब्रह्म यक्षरूपम्। तं ह देवाः न विजज्ञुः— ‘किमिदं यक्षम्’ इति।
verses.iast: tad brahma vijajñe— ‘teṣām evāyaṁ vijayaḥ, teṣām evāyaṁ mahimā’ iti. tebhyaḥ prādur babhūva brahma yakṣarūpam. taṁ ha devā na vijajñuḥ— ‘kim idaṁ yakṣam’ iti.
verses.translation: Brahman knew it and thought, ‘This victory and this glory are Theirs alone.’ He appeared before them as a Yaksha; the gods did not know what that wondrous being was.
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Brahman manifests to humble the gods’ pride.

verses.devanagari: ते अग्निम् अब्रुवन्— ‘अग्ने, एतद् विजानीहि— किमिदं यक्षम्’ इति। ‘तथे’त्युवाच।
verses.iast: te agnim abruvan— ‘agne, etad vijānīhi— kim idaṁ yakṣam’ iti. ‘tathe’ty uvāca.
verses.translation: They said to Agni, ‘O Agni, find out what this Yaksha is.’ He replied, ‘So be it.’
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Agni is sent to inquire about the Yaksha.

verses.devanagari: सोऽभ्यद्रवत्। तम् अभ्यवदत्— ‘कोऽसी’ति। ‘अग्निरस्मि, जातवेदः’ इति। ‘किं शक्तिस्ते’ति। ‘यदिदं पृथिव्याम् अस्ति किं च, सर्वं दहेयम्’ इति।
verses.iast: so ’bhyadravat. tam abhyavadat— ‘ko ’sī’ ti. ‘agnir asmi, jātavedaḥ’ iti. ‘kiṁ śaktis te’ ti. ‘yad idaṁ pṛthivyām asti kiṁ ca, sarvaṁ daheyam’ iti.
verses.translation: He went up and was asked, ‘Who are you?’ ‘I am Agni, Jātavedas,’ he said. ‘What power is yours?’ ‘Whatever exists upon earth, I can burn it to ashes.’
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Agni boasts of his potency before the Yaksha.

verses.devanagari: तस्मै तृणं निधायोवाच— ‘एतद् दह’ इति। तद् उपप्रेयाय; तन्नाशक्नोद् दग्धुम्। स ततो निववृते।
verses.iast: tasmai tṛṇaṁ nidhāyovāca— ‘etad daha’ iti. tad upapreyāya; tan nāśaknod dagdhum. sa tato nivavṛte.
verses.translation: He placed a blade of grass and said, ‘Burn this.’ Agni rushed at it but could not burn it; humbled, he turned back.
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Agni fails to burn even a blade of grass presented by the Yaksha.

verses.devanagari: ते वायुं अब्रुवन्— ‘वायो, एतद् विजानीहि— किमिदं यक्षम्’ इति। ‘तथे’त्युवाच।
verses.iast: te vāyuṁ abruvan— ‘vāyo, etad vijānīhi— kim idaṁ yakṣam’ iti. ‘tathe’ty uvāca.
verses.translation: Then they addressed Vāyu: ‘O Vāyu, discover what this Yaksha is.’ He said, ‘So be it.’
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: After Agni’s failure, Vāyu is sent.

verses.devanagari: सोऽभ्यद्रवत्। तम् अभ्यवदत्— ‘कोऽसी’ति। ‘वायुरस्मि, मातरिश्वा’ इति। ‘किं शक्तिस्ते’ति। ‘यदिदं पृथिव्याम् अस्ति किं च, सर्वं वाहयामि’ इति।
verses.iast: so ’bhyadravat. tam abhyavadat— ‘ko ’sī’ ti. ‘vāyur asmi, mātariśvā’ iti. ‘kiṁ śaktis te’ ti. ‘yad idaṁ pṛthivyām asti kiṁ ca, sarvaṁ vāhayāmi’ iti.
verses.translation: He went up. Asked, ‘Who are you?’ he answered, ‘I am Vāyu, Mātariśvan.’ ‘What is your power?’ ‘Whatever is upon earth, I can sweep it away.’
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Vāyu proclaims his might before the Yaksha.

verses.devanagari: तस्मै तृणं निधायोवाच— ‘एतद् वह’ इति। तद् उपप्रेयाय; नाशक्नोद् वाहयितुम्। स ततो निववृते।
verses.iast: tasmai tṛṇaṁ nidhāyovāca— ‘etad vaha’ iti. tad upapreyāya; nāśaknod vāhayitum. sa tato nivavṛte.
verses.translation: He set a blade of grass and said, ‘Carry this.’ Vāyu drew near, yet could not move it, and returned.
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Vāyu, too, fails before Brahman’s power.

verses.devanagari: ते इन्द्रम् अब्रुवन्— ‘मघवन्, एतद् विजानीहि— किमिदं यक्षम्’ इति। ‘तथे’त्युवाच। सोऽभ्यद्रवत्।
verses.iast: te indram abruvan— ‘maghavan, etad vijānīhi— kim idaṁ yakṣam’ iti. ‘tathe’ty uvāca. so ’bhyadravat.
verses.translation: Then they said to Indra: ‘O Maghavan, learn what this Yaksha is.’ He agreed and went forward.
verses.speaker: Śruti
verses.context: Indra himself goes to meet the mysterious Yaksha.

verses.devanagari: ते वायुम् अब्रुवन् — वायो, एतद् विजानीहि; किम् एतद् यक्षम् इति।
verses.iast: te vāyum abruvan — vāyo, etad vijānīhi; kim etad yakṣam iti.
verses.translation: The gods said to Vāyu, “O Vāyu, kindly find out—what is this wondrous Yakṣa?”

verses.devanagari: तथेति।
verses.iast: tatheti.
verses.translation: “So be it,” he agreed.

verses.devanagari: स त्वारित्वा अभ्यद्रवत्। तम् अब्रवीत् — कोऽसि? सोऽब्रवीत् — वायुरहमस्मि, मातरिश्वा इति।
verses.iast: sa tvaritvā abhyadravat. tam abravīt — ko'si? so'bravīt — vāyur aham asmi, mātariśvā iti.
verses.translation: He sped forward. The Yakṣa asked, “Who are you?” He replied, “I am Vāyu, called Mātariśvā.”

verses.devanagari: किं ते शक्तिरिति? यदिदं पृथिव्यां सर्वम् आवायेयम् इति।
verses.iast: kiṁ te śaktir iti? yad idaṁ pṛthivyāṁ sarvam āvāyeyam iti.
verses.translation: “What power is yours?”—“Whatever is here upon the earth, I could carry it off with my wind.”

verses.devanagari: तस्मै तृणं न्यदधात् — आवायेति। तत् उपप्रेयाय; नाशक्नोत्। स निववृते — न एनम् अविन्दं, किमेतद् यक्षम् इति।
verses.iast: tasmai tṛṇaṁ nyadadhāt — āvāyeti. tat upapreyāya; nāśaknot. sa nivavṛte — na enam avindaṁ, kim etad yakṣam iti.
verses.translation: He placed a straw before him: “Blow this.” Vāyu rushed upon it, yet could not move it. He returned, saying, “I could not discern who that Yakṣa was.”

verses.devanagari: ते इन्द्रम् अब्रुवन् — मघवन्, एतद् विजानीहि; किम् एतद् यक्षम् इति।
verses.iast: te indram abruvan — maghavan, etad vijānīhi; kim etad yakṣam iti.
verses.translation: Then they addressed Indra: “O Maghavan, find out—what is this Yakṣa?”

verses.devanagari: तथेति। स त्वारित्वा अभ्यद्रवत्। स तत्र न ददर्श तं यक्षम्।
verses.iast: tatheti. sa tvaritvā abhyadravat. sa tatra na dadarśa taṁ yakṣam.
verses.translation: “So be it.” He sped forward; but there he did not see that Yakṣa at all.

verses.devanagari: तस्मिन्नेवाकाशे स्त्रीं ददर्श बहुशोभमानाम् — उमां हैमवतीम्।
verses.iast: tasminn evākāśe strīṁ dadarśa bahuśobhamānām — umāṁ haimavatīm.
verses.translation: In that very expanse he beheld a radiant woman—Umā, the daughter of Himavat.

verses.devanagari: तां होवाच — किमेतद् यक्षम् इति?
verses.iast: tāṁ hovāca — kim etad yakṣam iti?
verses.translation: He inquired of her, “What was that Yakṣa?”

verses.devanagari: सा होवाच — ब्रह्मणो ह्येवेदं विजयः, ब्रह्मणो ह्येवेदं महिमेति।
verses.iast: sā hovāca — brahmaṇo hyevedaṁ vijayaḥ, brahmaṇo hyevedaṁ mahimeti.
verses.translation: She said, “It was the victory of Brahman alone; yes, the glory belongs to Brahman alone.”
